intro: Koanophyllon conglobatum, commonly known as the globular leaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its dense, woolly foliage and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically rounded and clustered at the base, forming a low-growing, mat-like structure. Koanophyllon conglobatum is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
